changes: docs(install): rewrite installation guide with full pip and Homebrew workflows for users and developers
docs(install): document Homebrew shell setup and indexly() wrapper for reliable CLI execution
chore(brew): integrate verified Homebrew formula with caveats into generate_brew_formula.py
chore(release): prepare Homebrew tap and documentation for v1.1.5 without code changes

archive.summary: fix(brew): correct Homebrew formula dependencies order and remove vendored numeric stack | fix(brew): rename Python resources to match PyPI package names (e.g., extract-msg)
fix(brew): vendor Python runtime dependencies to produce a fully functional Homebrew install | feat(brew): extend generate_brew_formula.py with PyPI resource resolution and sha256 verification
fix(brew): use bin/indexly in formula test block for Homebrew audit | chore(brew): update generate_brew_formula.py template for correct formula output
Fix(ci): use --formular flag for Homebrew audit after audit behavior change
Fixed Homebrew formula generation pipeline | Resolved Formula/indexly.rb creation failures due to GitHub tarball delays
fix(github actions): Updated Homebrew workflow to audit formula by name instead of file path.
fix(github actions): GitHub Actions: added missing Homebrew tap authentication token to enable automated `brew` releases.

feat(organize): introduced profile-based directory scaffolding with modular rules and safe placement planning | feat(organize): added dry-run placement planner with detailed logging and hash-based safety checks
fix(log): enforced LOG_MAX_BYTES to prevent uncontrolled incremental log growth | fix(ignore): improved ignore preset loading, loader cache handling, path matching, and CLI inspection output

fix(loader): correctly validate .ndjson files when extension is provided, resolving NDJSON fallback and allowing Indexly-exported concatenated logs to be analyzed directly | feat(log-clean): added multi-log cleaning with NDJSON/CSV export, path normalization and filename sanitization

feat(csv-cleaning): implemented a fully automated CSV data cleaning pipeline with smart datetime parsing, mixed-type handling, missing-value imputation, and Rich-based summary display | feat(csv-cleaning): added delimiter fallback detection and dynamic visualization integration for clean and intuitive data exploration

feat(rename-file): added support for pattern-based file renaming with placeholders {date}, {title}, and {counter} | feat(rename-file): implemented --counter-format flag for customizable numeric padding
meta: corrected project URLs in pyproject.toml for PyPI | Homepage now points to Netlify site instead of GitHub
fix: FAQ shortcode use global site.Data instead of .Site.Data to prevent context errors | fix: replace Colorama with Rich markup for search term highlighting
Unified snippet logic across FTS5 and regex search | Aligned regex output with FTS search including colored highlights and tags
Full CLI migration to argparse subparsers | Enhanced FTS5 search with logical operators, input validation, and snippet support
Added CSV file analysis via analyze-csv subcommand with summary export | Integrated pandas for robust CSV parsing and numeric/statistical summary
Modularized export logic into export_utils.py (pdf/txt/json) | Modularized filetype extraction into filetype_utils.py
Added fuzzy search support using --fuzzy and --fuzzy-threshold arguments | Implemented saved search profiles: --save-profile and --profile
Fixed CLI argument handling for --pdf-lib and --output to prevent errors | Improved internal argument validation for export options
Implemented CLI filters: --filetype, --date-from, --date-to, --path-contains | Integrated filters with FTS5 and regex search
Initial version with SQLite FTS5 search support | Added regex search using custom REGEXP function
